inclusion.criterion: Known sickle cell disease presenting with severe pain
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Written informed consent, ideally from both parents (and assent, where appropriate), obtained prior to painful crisis (for example, in Haematology clinic)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Verbal consent (and assent, where appropriate) obtained at the time of the painful crisis in the ED
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Hospital admission required for painful crisis
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patient has received parenteral narcotic analgesic within 4 hours of ED presentation
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Oxygen saturations below 95% on initial assessment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Altered conscious state as defined by a Glasgow Coma score less than 15
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient has participated in another clinical trial involving an Investigation Medicinal Product (IMP) within 4 weeks of dosing, or is currently enrolled in another clinical trial involving an IMP, or has been previously enrolled in this trial
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have any condition that would make him/her, in the opinion of the Investigator or Sponsor, unsuitable for the study, or who are, in the opinion of the Investigator, not likely to complete the study for any reason
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has a known history of sickle cell disease and is presenting with severe pain. He has been treated with oxycodone in the past two weeks, but it was not beneficial to his pain.
